abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column on Detroit Tigers first baseman Miguel Cabrera, who hit a two-run homer in team's 5-3 playoff victory over New York Yankees; says that some stars do not perform well in the postseason, but Cabrera seems to be comfortable in his first appearance since 2003.
snippet: Tigers Manager Jim Leyland says he does not mind Miguel Cabrera’s fraternizing with the opposition; Cabrera’s prodigious power certainly tends to make it tolerable.
lead_paragraph: Tigers Manager Jim Leyland says he does not mind Miguel Cabrera’s fraternizing with the opposition; Cabrera’s prodigious power certainly tends to make it tolerable.

headline.main: Tigers’ Cabrera Speaks Cordially and Carries a Big Stick
headline.print_headline: Tigers’ Cabrera Speaks Cordially and Carries a Big Stick
headline.seo: Tigers’ Cabrera Speaks Cordially and Carries a Big Stick
